title: Beef Stew
tagline: Rich French-style stew. Fork-tender meat, hearty vegetables.
description: Rich French-style beef stew. Fork-tender meat, vegetables. Serves 6.
ingredients: 3 lbs beef chuck roast, cut into 1½" cubes
1 tsp fresh thyme (or ½ tsp dried)
steps: Pat beef dry with paper towels. Season generously with salt and pepper, then toss with flour to coat lightly.
Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown beef in batches (don't crowd the pan). Remove to a plate. Takes about 10 minutes total.
Add onion to pot. Cook until softened, 5 minutes. Add garlic and tomato paste, cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in wine, scraping up browned bits from bottom. Simmer 2 minutes.
Return beef and any juices to pot. Add broth, balsamic, thyme, and bay leaves. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 1½ hours.
Add potatoes and carrots. Cover and cook 45 more minutes until vegetables and beef are tender.
Stir in peas, cook 5 minutes. Remove bay leaves. Taste and adjust seasoning.
notes: The key: Brown meat in batches. Crowding = steaming = no flavor.
Chuck roast vs stew meat: Buy a chuck roast and cut it yourself. Pre-cut "stew meat" is often random scraps.
Oven method: After step 5, cover and bake at 325°F for the remaining time.
Storage: Even better the next day. Keeps 4 days refrigerated, 3 months frozen.
source: Adapted from Once Upon a Chef
